meanings.definition: Relating to the science of cryptology.
meanings.sent1: The cryptological methods used by the detective helped solve the mystery.
meanings.sent2: The cryptological analysis of the ancient manuscript revealed hidden messages.
meanings.sent3: The spy's cryptological skills were so good, even the pigeons couldn't decipher his messages.
meanings.sent4: Her cryptological expertise was like a key that unlocked the secrets of the encrypted files.
meanings.sent5: The cryptological puzzles in the escape room challenged even the most experienced codebreakers.

meanings.definition: Involving the study of codes and ciphers.
meanings.sent1: The cryptological course at the academy taught students how to decode secret messages.
meanings.sent2: The cryptological techniques used by the military kept their communications secure.
meanings.sent3: The cryptological challenge at the competition tested the participants' codebreaking skills.
meanings.sent4: His cryptological abilities were so advanced, he could crack even the most complex ciphers.
meanings.sent5: The cryptological exhibit at the museum showcased historical encryption methods.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to the techniques of secret writing and communication.
meanings.sent1: The spy's cryptological messages were so well-hidden, only his contact could decipher them.
meanings.sent2: The cryptological tools used by the ancient civilization were ahead of their time.
meanings.sent3: The cryptological workshop taught participants how to create their own secret codes.
meanings.sent4: Her cryptological skills were like magic, turning ordinary text into encrypted messages.
meanings.sent5: The cryptological conference brought together experts in the field of secret communication.
